intro: Elynanthus borbonicus, commonly known as the Bourbon milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Elynanthus borbonicus is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat and is often found in dry, open woodlands or along rocky outcrops. Its unique floral structure and ecological role make it an important species for local pollinators.
